main event: A U.S. Navy aircraft reported a sighting of an unidentified flying object over the Indian Ocean on 8 June 1963.
interesting points: The object was initially thought to resemble a large high-altitude weather balloon but was later observed to be a metallic disk about 50-60 feet in diameter., The disk hovered at an altitude of approximately 5000 feet before accelerating at a high speed and disappearing in 2-3 seconds., The object emitted no sound, vapor trail, or exhaust., Witnesses included the pilot, co-pilot, and navigator of the aircraft, all of whom agreed it was not any known type of aerial vehicle., The sighting lasted approximately 3-4 minutes and included visual confirmation of a luminous disc.
witness description: crew members of a U.S. Navy aircraft
